summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 discussing a request for reimbursement of counseling treatment costs for a Florida-based victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The victim lacks health insurance and has paid for treatment sessions from July to October 2020. The email seeks approval for payment of outstanding invoices.

persons.name: Angela
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding reimbursement for a victim's counseling treatment; appears to be a point of contact for approval and payment processes.

events.title: Meeting regarding victim
events.description: A meeting was held where the victim was present, as referenced in the email.

events.title: Counseling session for victim
events.description: Victim attended a 2-hour counseling session at $150 per hour.

events.title: Scheduled counseling appointment
events.description: Victim had a scheduled counseling appointment, but the invoice was not yet available.

keyFacts: A Florida-based victim of Jeffrey Epstein is seeking reimbursement for counseling treatment costs from July to October 2020.
The victim lacks health insurance and has paid for treatment out-of-pocket, with some invoices already paid and others outstanding.
The email indicates the victim had been interviewed as part of the Epstein investigation.
Approval was needed prior to treatment reimbursement, highlighting procedural steps in victim support.
The correspondence shows ongoing financial and support considerations for Epstein victims years after the main events.
